elements.title: Silvana Estrada: ‘Como Un Pájaro’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Silvana Estrada: ‘Como Un Pájaro’

 Best New Music

During the pandemic, Silvana Estrada found herself home alone and broken-hearted. She was also facing some serious insomnia so she picked up her guitar and went to work.

Jun. 20

elements.title: Mocky: ‘Music Will Explain’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Mocky: ‘Music Will Explain’

 Best New Music

AI can’t feel the beat, but Mocky can. That’s why this groovy single uses live instrumentation and analog recording to celebrate the power of the human voice.

Jun. 19

elements.title: url: ‘skin’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
url: ‘skin’

 Best New Music

Brooklyn-based artist and producer url just dropped this indie-pop love song that’s built from English and French vocal samples.

Jun. 18

elements.title: Yaya Bey: ‘raisins’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Yaya Bey: ‘raisins’

 Best New Music

Yaya Bey’s “raisins” is all about the bravery required to pursue a career as an artist; dreaming big and keeping the faith through the more sobering realities of the job.

Jun. 17

elements.title: Sparks: ‘Running Up A Tab At The Hotel For The Fab’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Sparks: ‘Running Up A Tab At The Hotel For The Fab’

 Best New Music

LA band Sparks always delights us with their sophisticated-yet-playful songwriting.

Jun. 16

elements.title: Miso Extra: ‘POP’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Miso Extra: ‘POP’

 Best New Music

Earcandy, the debut album by Japanese-British singer and producer Miso Extra , is an infectious mix of K-Pop, UK Garage, tongue-in-cheek sensibility, and sultry, ear-catching textures.

Jun. 13

elements.title: Turnstile: ‘Never Enough’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Turnstile: ‘Never Enough’

 Best New Music

Formed in 2010, Baltimore’s Turnstile are a band that always moves forward boldly and collectively — despite what their name might suggest.

Jun. 12

elements.title: Pearl & The Oysters: ‘Sous la lune mandarine’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Pearl & The Oysters: ‘Sous la lune mandarine’

 Best New Music

“Under The Mandarin Moon,” or as Pearl & The Oysters say “Sous la lune mandarine,” is the latest example of the group’s musical superpower: exploring a difficult subject over a…

Jun. 11
